document.docTitle: Amphictene undulata Zhang & Hutchings 2019, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of Australian Pectinariidae (Polychaeta), with new species and new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of Australian Pectinariidae (Polychaeta), with new species and new records

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Australia , West Australia : Holotype : MV F151408 , off Ningaloo North , Western Australia , 21°58'08–42”S 113°45’14–40”E,
726 – 732 m
, coll. Poore , Gary C. ,
11 Dec 2005
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 13.
Amphictene undulata
n. sp. Holotype (MV F151408): A. Dorso-lateral view of anterior end; B. Ventral view of anterior end; C. Dorsal view of scaphe; D. Dorso-lateral view of posterior end; E. Notochaeta; F–G. Uncini; H. Scaphal hook. Abbreviations: ac, anal cirrus; af, anal flap; br, branchiae; bt, buccal tentacles; cv, cephalic veil; dlp, dorso-lateral pads; lt, large tooth; mat, major teeth; mit, minor teeth; nec, neurochaetae; noc, notochaetae; op, operculum; or, opercular rim; p, paleae; s, segment; sc, scaphe; sh, scaphal hooks; tc, tentacular cirri; vl, ventral lappet.

FIGURE 14.
Amphictene undulata
n. sp. Methyl Green stained body of Holotype (MV F151408): A. Dorsal view of entire body; B. Ventral view of entire body; C. Ventral view of anterior end; D. Scaphal hooks; E. Dorso-lateral view of anterior end; F. Lateral view of posterior end. Abbreviations: ac, anal cirrus; af, anal flap; br, branchiae; bt, buccal tentacles; cv, cephalic veil; dlp, dorso-lateral pad; op, operculum; or, opercular rim; p, paleae; s, segment; sc, scaphe; sh, scaphal hooks; tc, tentacular cirri; vl, ventral lappet.

FIGURE 15.
Amphictene undulata
n. sp. chaetae of Holotype (MV F151408): A–C. Close up of notochaetae, segment 11; D– F. Uncini, segment 11.

subSubSection.paragraph: Methyl Green stained body distinctly green on cirri of cephalic veil, ventral lobes of segments 2–6, base of 2 nd pair of tentacular cirri, dorso-lateral pads of segments 3–4, ventro-lateral regions adjacent to neuropodia, regions between segment 21 and scaphe, margins of scaphe, and ventro-lateral regions near posterior four pairs of lateral lobes on scaphe ( Fig. 14 ).

Type Locality.
NW of Western Australia ( Fig. 1 ), currently only known from type locality
.
Etymology. The species is named from the Latin word “undulata” as opercular margin of the species is slightly undulated.

Remarks . The holotype of
A. undulata
n. sp.
, has a damaged rim of the cephalic veil with numerous fine cirri on anterior-left margin which almost certainly represent regenerating cirri ( Figs 13B ; 14C ).
Amphictene undulata
n. sp.
is distinguished from all other species of
Amphictene
by the following characters: slightly undulating dorsal and lateral margins of operculum; 15 pairs of paleae; and uncini with one enlarged tooth and two longitudinal rows of major teeth (Table 1).
Amphictene undulata
n. sp.
is very similar to
A. uniloba Hutchings & Peart, 2002
, as they both have one enlarged medial tooth on each uncinus and almost rounded lobes on the opercular margin, but can be distinguished from
A. uniloba
which has more longitudinal rows (3 – 4 rows) of major uncinial teeth, triangular lobes on opercular margin and distinctly curved scaphal hooks (Table 1).
